PERSONA:
meet juan carlos gómez, a 38-year-old hispanic male who resides in the metropolitan area of tampa, florida. born in el salvador, juan carlos moved to the united states with his family at the age of 17 and has spent the past 21 years acclimating to american life. he attained u.s. citizenship ten years ago, a milestone he considers pivotal in his journey as an immigrant. juan carlos holds strong ties to his salvadoran heritage, often incorporating traditional practices into his daily life.

juan carlos is a college graduate with a degree in environmental science from the university of south florida, where he also attended some postgraduate courses. he currently works as a sustainability consultant for a tampa-based firm, leveraging his passion for the environment to advise companies on reducing their ecological footprint. his annual income stands at $62,400, placing him in the lower-middle-income bracket.

religiously, juan carlos identifies as a protestant, born-again christian, attending church a few times a year at his local community church in the vibrant neighborhood of west tampa. this spiritual background influences his views on social justice and community service, leading him to volunteer regularly at local environmental conservation projects.

politically, juan carlos leans liberal, aligning with the democratic party. his experiences as an immigrant and his stance on environmental issues have shaped his support for policies that advocate for climate change action, pathways to citizenship for undocumented immigrants, and social equality. juan carlos is an avid user of the internet, often using social media to stay up-to-date on current events and engage in discussions on issues he vehemently supports.

juan carlos is married to ana, a 36-year-old schoolteacher, and they have two children, ages 7 and 9. they rent their home in a diverse, well-maintained neighborhood with a mix of old and new single-family homes. while he values homeownership, juan carlos is content renting, citing the flexibility it provides for his family's current lifestyle. juan carlos's commitment to his community is evident in his volunteer work and his engagement in neighborhood initiatives that promote sustainability and cultural exchange.

despite his enviable life, juan carlos worries about environmental policy rollbacks and immigration reforms that may affect the dreams of others like him who seek a better life in america. these concerns fuel his political activism and desire for civic engagement, compounded by his very liberal ideology that pushes him to support progressive candidates and policies that reflect his belief in a more inclusive and environmentally conscious society.
